DOCNAME: CASE OF EVT COMPANY v. SERBIA
TEXT: CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in GPE NORP sud u ORG ) ordered “ GPE ” , a company based in GPE , to hand QUANTITY of common salt to the applicant , and pay its legal costs in the amount of MONEY ( “ YUD ” ) .
CARDINAL . This judgment became final by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed an enforcement request in respect of the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG in Leskovac ( “ the ORG ” ) issued an enforcement order against the respondent company ( “ the debtor ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG adopted a decision stating that the debtor could not deliver the specified amount of common salt and , instead , ordered it to pay to the applicant ORG CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , the debtor was transformed into CARDINAL separate companies - “ Holding Jedinstvo ” , “ PERSON grad ” and “ DATE . novembar ” , all based in GPE , and “ FAC based in Bošnjaca ( “ the debtors ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the debtors to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL with statutory interest as of DATE , plus another ORG CARDINAL for legal costs , and ruled that they had jointly assumed the financial obligations of the initial debtor .
CARDINAL . On DATE and CARDINAL September CARDINAL , ORG and ORG in GPE ( ORG privredni sud u ORG ) , respectively , rejected the debtors ' requests for a stay of the enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a submission with ORG , seeking the expedition of these proceedings .
CARDINAL . Mr PERSON subsequently became the applicant 's owner and authorised representative .

CARDINAL . NORP Throughout this time and during DATE that followed , the applicant proposed different means of enforcement , including bank account seizures as well as the auctioning of the debtors ' movable and , if needed , immovable assets . It emphasised that , where appropriate , police assistance should be sought .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively , the applicant filed requests to this effect with ORG and urged that the proceedings be expedited .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sent a complaint , by post , to ORG and GPE , stating , inter alia , that the debtors still had sufficient assets to pay their outstanding obligation , as ORG would have otherwise been “ only too glad ” to declare the enforcement impossible ( “ sud bi [ inače ] jedva [ do]čekao da [ to ] konstatuje i obavesti nas kako je nemoguće sprovesti izvršenje ” ) . This complaint , however , appears not to have reached ORG and GPE .
CARDINAL . By DATE the debtors paid the applicant a total of MONEY , the domestic currency having been renamed in the meantime .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicant complained to ORG , on DATE to ORG in GPE , and on DATE and DATE to ORG ( PERSON ) , respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG informed the applicant that the enforcement proceedings had been hindered by the debtors ' employees as well as the police . While the former physically prevented the bailiffs from conducting an inventory of the debtors ' movable assets , on several separate occasions , the latter refused to assist the bailiffs in their subsequent attempts to seize those very assets . The President further noted that the most recent refusal of the police to assist the bailiffs occurred on DATE , which is why the enforcement had to be postponed . Finally , he stated that the proceedings would recommence as soon as the judge handling the case clarified the situation with the head of the local police , and concluded that the refusal of the police to assist the bailiffs in their duties was common in cases involving “ discontented workers ” engaged in the obstruction of judicial enforcement proceedings .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that the enforcement court is obliged to proceed urgently .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , if need be , bailiffs may request police assistance . Should the police fail to provide such assistance , the enforcement court shall inform the Minister of ORG , the Government , or the competent parliamentary body of this failure .

CARDINAL . This Act entered into force on DATE , thereby repealing LAW CARDINAL . In accordance with Article CARDINAL , however , all enforcement proceedings instituted prior to DATE are to be concluded pursuant to LAW .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that statutory interest shall be paid as of the date of maturity of a recognised monetary claim until the date of its settlement ( which includes awards granted by final court judgments ) .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL states that such interest shall be calculated on the basis of the official retail price index ( mesečna stopa rasta cena na malo ) plus another PERCENT DATE ( mesečna fiksna stopa ) .

CARDINAL . Article QUANTITY provides , inter alia , that judicial insolvency proceedings may be instituted by a company 's creditor , providing that it can substantiate its claim and document that the debtor in question can not otherwise cover its outstanding obligations .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , inter alia , ORG ( ORG banka ORG ) shall monitor the solvency of all corporate entities and initiate judicial insolvency proceedings in respect of those whose bank accounts have been “ blocked ” due to outstanding debts for a period of DATE consecutively , or for DATE intermittently , within DATE .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of this LAW read as follows :
“ ORG shall set up a ORG [ “ PERSON odbor ” ] ( “ the Board ” ) .
ORG shall be composed of CARDINAL ORG judges elected for DATE by the plenary session of ORG . ”
“ In response to a complaint or ex officio , ORG is authorised to oversee judicial proceedings and look into the conduct of individual cases .

Following the conclusion of this process , the ORG may initiate , before ORG , proceedings for the removal of a judge based on his unconscientious or unprofessional conduct , or propose the imposition of other disciplinary measures . ”

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of this Code incriminate “ obstruction of an official in the performance of his or her duties ” ( sprečavanje službenog lica u vršenju službene dužnosti ) , “ abuse of office ” ( zloupotreba službenog položaja ) , “ judicial malfeasance ” ( kršenje zakona od strane sudije ) and “ official malfeasance ” ( nesavestan rad u službi ) , respectively .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL incriminates “ non - enforcement of a court decision ” ( neizvršenje sudske odluke ) .
CARDINAL . This Code entered into force on DATE , thereby repealing LAW .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions concerning ORG and GPE and the succession of ORG and GPE are set out in GPE judgment ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL , DATE ) .
